alert.note: Alert for Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 6:56PM CDT until August 11 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following county, Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area with the majority falling in less than one half hour. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bartlesville... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
